TopicTitle: I've created Battle Tanks and released it

Articles.Content:
(Dear mods, I hope it is okay to post this here. If not, please let me know.)

I've been really busy lately creating a new Android game, which is an online multiplayer game where players use their tanks to destroy enemy tanks. Tanks can be upgraded in various categories. The tank controls allow for multi-touch so that players can aim and shoot while driving.

[Battle Tanks on Google Play](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=de.blizzy.battletanks)

![k5VhCbxGIoRyyeQ43RTcsupISg5nNP2d0yanS4gF2JGc5sGVfpVNo3HGcOyJ6zPQ=h310](https://lh5.ggpht.com/k5VhCbxGIoRyyeQ43RTcsupISg5nNP2d0yanS4gF2JGc5sGVfpVNo3HGcOyJ6zPQ=h310)

![HS6g3anWT3acCjxXg8_rDRnD8H-Kwiek5G3fKSzqZZDLOdvGK7y2VW1lo_FEYCjJv9jM=h310](https://lh5.ggpht.com/HS6g3anWT3acCjxXg8_rDRnD8H-Kwiek5G3fKSzqZZDLOdvGK7y2VW1lo_FEYCjJv9jM=h310)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-20T13:50:52Z" title="03/20/2015 01:50  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 20, 2015</time> by blizzy78**
Well its ok. I created a account but when I got to the main menu parts were cut off by the action bar. When I tried to join a match there was no one there. Also why do you want my email?

> 
> I created a account but when I got to the main menu parts were cut off by the action bar.

Ah, I was a bit afraid of that. My test device is rather big (10.1"). So in general you need to make sure that GUI elements stay the same physical size (which I did), but then of course you run into the problem that smaller devices can't display everything if you make it too big.

Long story short, I shall make some adjustments to the UI ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> When I tried to join a match there was no one there.

Yes, that's to be expected for a bit, since the game is just released. You are literally "FIRST!" ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> Also why do you want my email?

That would be used for sending you a message in case you forget your password. I don't plan on using it in any other way right now.

I should probably add some note in the UI about that.

---

If you're still with me, how did you like controlling the tank in general? I know you were alone, but I'd guess you drove around and fired some shots.

(During development, I have been getting a request to also provide an alternative way of controlling the tank. Still thinking about how to go forward with that.)
Any plans for iOS? Many of us don't have Android.
I'd like to release for iOS, too, and it's certainly technically possible, but - I don't have an iOS test device in my possession :-(
Hmm, seeing that an iPad mini Retina 32 GB comes in at about 320 Euros, it might be possible for me to do it...

Just tried again. Still no one there. I'm personally not in love with the controls. Driving is fine but trying to drive and shoot is a mess. I personally think that having a separate simulated joystick to drive the tank would work best.

> 
> Just tried again. Still no one there.

I'm afraid it will stay that way for a while. It's quite hard to build a community when there's practically no chance of hyping your stuff.

Also, I was asleep when you tried ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> I personally think that having a separate simulated joystick to drive the tank would work best.

Okay, that is very helpful feedback, thanks! I also get the feeling that using multi-touch isn't too good an idea here. The problem is that your hands are generally too big such that they will obscure large parts of the screen, making it difficult to see your enemies.

I will implement a virtual joystick like you suggested over the next days. I think I'll leave the multi-touch controls in for now, they shouldn't hurt.
Good news, I have the game running on my new iPad now.
Is it already in the appstore? Somehow i can't find it.

No, no, that will take a while still. I literally just have managed to get it running on an iOS device for the first time. Also there are a few things I want to get done before the next update/iOS release.

What are the requirements to run it? I got a "Your device isn't compatible with this version." ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif) on the play store page for my Huawei Ascend Mate 2 (1280x720, 2GB RAM, Android v. 4.3).

Hmm, I'm not sure actually. I've specified that the physical size of target devices must be at least "large", which according to this graphic from Google:

![screens-ranges.png](https://developer.android.com/images/screens_support/screens-ranges.png)

should include your device. Additionally, I've allowed any pixel density. So it really should cover the Mate 2.

However, in the Google Play section where you upload your apps, I can see that the app does not support the Mate 2, but it does support the older Mate. So perhaps this is a misclassification on Huawei's part?

Edit: Having said all that, 6.1" is really quite tiny. I'm currently in the process of optimizing for 7.0", which really is the minimum target size I'm shooting for.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-26T20:10:22Z" title="02/26/2015 08:10  PM" data-short="9 yr">February 26, 2015</time> by blizzy78**
Thanks, I look forward to trying the iPad version.

I've just released an update on Android that removes the touch control for tanks in favor of a D-Pad and buttons. This version is also optimized for smaller devices (7.0"+)

Submission to Apple's store should take place next week.

> 
> Submission to Apple's store should take place next week.

Looks like this will take a while longer while Unity is working out some of the kinks with the new Unity 5. Doesn't keep me from working on it and releasing updates on Android, though ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I should be submitting the game to Apple's store this weekend. No clue how long the review process will take, though, and if it gets through first round ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Incompatible with all devices (Huawei Ascend G630 5" 1280x720 1GB RAM) 

Good luck!

> 
> Incompatible with all devices (Huawei Ascend G630 5" 1280x720 1GB RAM)

Please see [this post above](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/111460-I-ve-created-Battle-Tanks-and-released-it?p=1760675&viewfull=1#post1760675).

Just noticed this thread. Only apple phones and tablets in my household at the moment but I'm interested to test it out and give feedback when available.

I've subscribed to keep an eye on progress. Good luck pushing this project forward!

Thanks! At the moment it is still very hard. Not because of technical hurdles, but in creating an active community. That is, if you log into the game, most of the time there is noone there to play against, because there are only a few players registered in the first place. So that is why I'm going to more platforms as well. I'm also planning on putting this up on Steam Greenlight some day. (Yes, it is possible to play cross-platform.)

- - - Updated - - -

By the way, I think I can add you as a tester if you like. The game does not need to be fully released on the App Store to do that. (Same goes for everyone else interested in trying the iOS version.)

I've heard that the app store can be annoying when it comes to testing. I'm afraid I don't know anything specific as this is basically hear-say from other developers in my last job. Obviously you're not that far along in the process yet, but if you haven't already, you should look into their procedures and requirements for handling in-development software and updates just to be sure you know what's going on.

Of course, let me know if it turns out this is baseless rumor. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

I like to believe that they are doing it all for the good of the App Store. If you look at Google Play, there is an awful lot of crap in there that you will never want to install on your device, let alone spend any amount of money on.

But yeah, I've also only read about their process on various sites. Bottom line is that they seem to be rather strict, and they also take their good time. My other game [Luminoso](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92857) is sitting in the "waiting for review" queue for 5 days now.

Alright, I've just submitted the game for review on the App Store. Fingers crossed ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

I can still add anyone interested as a beta tester, by the way.
